title: Green energy revolution: How are microinverters changing the solar landscape in India?
description: India aims to boost solar capacity to 849 GW by 2032 from 399.5 GW in 2022, backed by the PM SuryaGhar program. Microinverters mitigate failure risks, ensure 99.8% availability, enhance energy harvest, simplify installation, and cut downtime. They are projected to reach $530 million by 2029, signaling a practical shift in solar technology.
